Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2011 05:18PM racemom wrote: Thanks, Houndmommy (love your screen name!) - my consult for the radiation is Jan 10 (4 wks after surgery) so I guess it will start awhile after that.  Did you have reconstruction?  I didn't and although my incision is numb, I'm sore above it and in the area where my right drain was. After I've had on a bra for a few hours, I just want to take it off!!  Still have some fluid above the incision, too.  Were you sore for awhile?
Posts.Title: Radiation After Mastectomy racemom Houndmommy

Posts.Content: racemom wrote: Has anyone else had radiation after a mastectomy?  My tumor was large so Dr says I should have it even though my nodes were clear. Supposed to start later this month - I'm still sore from surgery and concerned how radiation will affect that. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Radiation After Mastectomy racemom Houndmommy

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2010 01:34PM racemom wrote: firedancer - I feel like you - I've been really busy so the surgery has seemed far away, but now its only 13 days away and when I really start to think about it, I get scared.  I have an appt. with the Dr on 12/2 - I have questions and really haven't talked with him face to face since we discussed my biopsy results.  I guess everything will seem more real after that.  Just praying for lymph nodes to be ok.  A couple of weeks ago went in for a Lymph node needle biopsy because my breast MRI showed 2 suspicious looking nodes - but when I got there and they did the ultrasound the radiologist said they all look normal and we didn't need to do the biopsy!  Said that sometimes the breast biopsy can make them appear reactive for awhile.  I prefer to think that it was an answer to prayer!  So - I am praying that was a good sign for the SNB. Everyone have a nice Thanksgiving - sending good thoughts. Pam  Diagnosis 10/26/10, ILC,6+cm,Gr 2, ER+ PR+, Herc2-
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2010 09:26AM racemom wrote: Had my surgery on the 8th and am very thankful that my nodes were clear.  Feeling ok - my incision isn't bothering me at all, the only thing that is tender are the two drains - but tylenol is helping alot.  Can't wait to get them out - I'm to call the nurse Monday and tell her the amounts I'm still draining. Try not to be too scared - the waiting was definitely alot worse than the surgery.  God bless everyone with  a short recovery!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2010 08:58AM racemom wrote: Glad to see I'm in good company for a December surgery.  Mine is Dec. 8 - right breast masectomy, no reconstruction.  I guess I'm not the only one that feels like this has taken forever, my biopsy was Oct. 19.  This is my second cancer - last one was 13 years ago on left breast, just calcifications, IDC, no nodes, had lumpectomy and radiation.  This one is right breast, ILC, 6+cm.  Oncotype test showed 12% chance of reoccurrence so Dr doesn't think I need chemo. Praying my nodes will be clear after surgery.  I'm scared but trying to keep my faith up.  I'm going to go Xmas shopping this week-end - but I really am NOT in the mood!  I'm sending positive thoughts for everyone.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2010 01:54PM racemom wrote: I have an appointment with the Dr tomorrow, too - first time I've spoken with him face to face since after the biopsy.  Well, 7 more days till D-Day (or should I say "B" Day) - my sense of humor is starting to get very weird....I think it's all this waiting.  I wish I could have just gotten this done right after the biopsy - much less time to think about it.  At least I've gotten my Christmas shopping about done!  I'm praying for all of you. Diagnosis: 10/25/10,ILC,6+cm,Grade 2,ER+,PR+,HER2-,Onco 19
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2010 08:01AM - edited Dec 6, 2010 08:02AM by racemom 2 more days - I'm going for the SNB shots tomorrow and surgery Wed am.  So glad to hear everyone seems to be doing great - I'm scared but at peace also.  Just need to get this over with!! Hugs  to everyone! Pam  Diagnosis:10/25/10,ILC,Grade 2,ER+,PR+,6+ CM?,HER2-,Onco 19
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer
